intro: Eugenia nyassensis, commonly known as the Nyassa myrtle, is a small evergreen tree native to the tropical regions of eastern Africa. It belongs to the Myrtaceae family, characterized by aromatic leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 5–10 meters and has smooth, greyish bark. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and emit a mild fragrance when crushed. The tree produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, fleshy berries.
